msItem.title: Fragments of a Jacobite Lectionary from the Acts and the Pauline Epistles

item.p: Ten paper leaves, about 7 in. by 5 1/8, some of which are slightly torn. There are nine lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is neat and regular, of the xvth cent., with numerous Greek vowels.

msItem.title: Fragments of a Jacobite Lectionary from the Epistles

item.p: Seven paper leaves, about 7 1/8 in. by 5 1/8, all more or less torn (Add. 14,737, foll. 11—17). There are 16 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is of the xivth cent., with occasional Greek vowels.

item.p: Seventeen paper leaves, about 6 7/8 in. by 5 1/8, all of which are much stained and some slightly torn. There are 10 lines in each page.

handNote.desc: The writing is good and regular, of the xiiith cent.

item.p: Eight paper leaves, about 6 5/8 in. by 4 7/8, all more or less stained and torn.

handNote.desc: Written in a good, regular hand, and dated, A. Gr. 1486, A.D. 1175.

item.p:
The colophon is much effaced, but it appears that the name of the writer was Bar-saumā bar 'Isā, from the village of Bā-Cūdīdā, near Mosul
, and that he wrote it at a place called Ibrāhīmīya, near Māridīn and Dunaisar .

p.quote: ܫܩ̣ܠ ܕܝܢ ܣܘܝܟܐ ܟܝܬ ܘܫܘܡܠܝܐ ܟܬܒܐ ܗܢܐ. ܒܫ̇ܢ̣ܬܐ. ܏ܕܐ. ܏ܘܬ. ܏ܘܦ. ܘܫܬܐ ܒܕܝ̈ܘܢܝܐ. ܒܐܝܪܚܐ (sic) ܐܕܪ. ܝܘܡ ܬܪ̈ܝܢ ܒܫܒܐ. ܒܬܠܬ ܫ̈ܥܝܢ ܕܝܘܡܐ. ܒ܏ܝܙ ܝܘܡ̈ܝܢ ܒܗ ܒܝܪܚܐ ܕܐܡܝܪ. ܒܐܝ̣̈ܕܝ ܐܢܫ ܕܘܿܝܐ ܘܚ̇ܠܫܐ ܘܡܣܡܥܠ ܒܚ̈ܛܗܐ. ܘܢܦ̣ܬܐ ܕܟܠܢܫ. ܒܪܨܘܡܐ ܕܒܫܡܐ ܡ܏ܫܡ ܒܪ ܥܝܣܐ ܕܡܢ ܐܬܪܐ ܕܢܝܢܘܐ ܡܛܪܦ܏ܘܠܝ ܡܢ ܒܐܟܘܕܝܕܐ ܩܪܝܬܐ ܡܒܪܟܬܐ ܕܡܗܝ̈ܡܢܐ. ܒܐܣܛܪܐ ܕܐܬܪܐ ܕܢܝܢܘܐ ܘܕܡܘܨܠ. ܟܬܒܗ ܕܝܢ ܒܐܒܪܗ[ܡـ]ܝܗ ܩܪܝܬܐ ܡܒܪܟܬܐ ܕܥܠ ܢܗܪܐ ܒܲܐܘܣܐ (?) ܒܐܬܪܐ ܕܝܢ ܕܡܪܕܐ ܘܕܘܢܝܣܪ. ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܐܒ̈ܗܬܐ ܩܕܝ̈ܫܐ ܡܪܝ ܡܝܟܐܝܠ Michael the Great. See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. ii., p. 362; Le Quien, Or. Christ., t. ii., col. 1389. ܦܛ܏ܪܝ ܕܐܢܛܝܘܟܝܐ ܕܣܘܪܝܐ. ܘܡܪܝ ܡܪܩܘܣ ܕܒܐܪܝܢ ܘܕܐܓܢܛܝܐ (?) ܘܡܪܝ ܝܘܚܢܢ John V., of Serug . See Assemani, Bibl. Or., t. ii., p. 452; Le Quien, Or. Christ., t. ii., col. 1548. ܡܦܪܝܢܐ ܘܩܬܘܠܝܩܐ ܕܬܪܝܬ ܘܕܢܝܢܘܐ. ܏ܘܫ

item.p: A paper leaf, about 6 3/4 in. by 5, slightly mutilated.

handNote.desc: Dated A. Gr. 1643, A.D. 1332.
The prayer on the verso is in Arabic.

item.p: It exhibits on the recto, at the top, the date A. Gr. 1643, A.D. 1332.

p.quote: ܒܪܝܫ ܝܪܚܐ ܬܡܘܙ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦ̈ ܘܫܬܡ̈ܐܐ ܘܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ (sic) ܘܬܠܬ ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ

item.p: Beneath the date is the following notice, apparently in the same handwriting:

p.quote: ܓ݁ܠܝܡܢ (Guillaume?) ܡܢ ܡܓܘܨܐ (Moguntia, Mainz?) ܢܣܒ ܒܝܬܐ ܒܕܪܬܐ ܕܣܝܪܓ݂ܪܓ݂ (Ser Giorgio?) ܒ̈ܬܫܥܐ ܕܝܢܪ̈ܐ ܒܫܢܬܐ ܟܠ ܝܪܚܐ ܬܠܬܐ ܨܘ̈ܠܐ ܬܠ̈ܬܝܢ ܘܫ̈ܬܐ ܙܘ̈ܙܐ ܥܣܪܝܢ ܝܘܡܝܢ ܒܕܪ (sic) ܝܪܚܐ ܝܘܡ ܥܪܘܒܬܐ ܘܝܗ̣ܒ ܪܗܒܢܐ ܏ܝܒ ܙܘ̈ܙܐ

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

altIdentifier.collection: William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838
William Wright, Catalogue of the Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

item.p: A paper leaf, about 6 7/8 in. by 4 7/8.

handNote.desc: The note was written by Gabriel.
The note was also written by Gabriel's nephew, Abraham.

item.p: The following note was written by Gabriel and his nephew, Abraham, monks of Beth Severina, who repaired and bound certain volumes in the library of the convent of S. Mary Deipara , in the year 1804, A.D. 1493, when Severus (Cyriacus) was abbat.

p.quote: ܕܦܓ݁ܥ ܘܡܨܠܐ ܡܛܠ ܡܪܢ̣ ܢܐܡܪ ܐܠܗܐ ܢܚܣܐ ܘܢܫܒܘܩ ܚ̈ܛܗܘܗܝ ܕܓܒܪܐܝܠ ܕܘܝܐ ܕܚ̇ܕܬ ܒܠܝܘܬܗܘܢ ܕܟܬܒ̈ܐ ܗܠܝܢ ܘܕܒ̇ܩ. ܘܕܒܪ ܐܚ܏ܘ ܪܒܢ ܐܒܪܗܡ ܩܫܝܫܐ. ܕܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ ܒܫܡ ܕܝܪ̈ܝܐ ܡܕܢܚ̈ܝܐ ܣ̇ܒܝܪ̈ܝܢܝܐ. ܒܢ̈ܝ ܬܘܠܡܕܐ ܕܝܠܗ ܕܥܘܡܪܐ ܏ܩܕ ܐܘܟܝܬ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܡܪܝ ܫܡܘܐܝܠ ܘܡܪܝ ܫܡܥܘܢ ܘܡܪܝ ܓܒܪܐܝܠ. ܗܘ̈ܝ ܒܢܫܬ ܐ܏ܦܕ ܕ܏ܝܘܢ ܒܐܝܕ̈ܝ ܚ̈ܛܝܐ ܕܥܗܝܕܝܢ ܟܕ ܐܝܬܝܗܘܢ ܥܡܘܪ̈ܐ ܘܬܘ̈ܬܒܐ ܒܕܝܪܐ ܗܕܐ ܩܕܝܫܬܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ. ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ ܕܐܣܩܝܛܝ ܐܝܟ ܕܠܥܘܗܕܢܐ. ܒܝ̈ܘܡܝ ܐܒܘܢ ܡܪܝ ܣܐܘܝܪܐ ܚܣܝܐ ܕܗ̣ܘ ܩܘܪܝܩܘܣ ܪܝܫ ܕܝܪܐ ܕܝܠܗ̇ ܕܕܝܪܐ ܕܝܠܕܬ ܐܠܗܐ ܕܒܡܕܒܪܐ. ܕܗ̣ܝ ܕܣܘܪ̈ܝܐܝܐ

item.p: Lower down, another oriental monk named Bar 'Isa has recorded his name, in the year 1840, A.D. 1529.

p.quote: ܒܪ ܥܝܣܐ ܒܪ ܩܫܐ ܝܫܘܥ ܡܢ ܩܣܛܪܐ ܡܒܪܟܬܐ ܒܫܢܬ ܐܠܦܐ ܘܬܡܐܢܝܡܐܐ ܘܪ̈ܒܥܝܢ (sic) ܕܝܘ̈ܢܝܐ

recordHist.source: Manuscript description based on Wright's Catalogue . abbreviated by the Syriaca.org editors.

bibl.author: William Wright
bibl.title: Catalogue of Syriac Manuscripts in the British Museum Acquired since the Year 1838

interpretation.p: Description is based on Wright's Catalogue without consultation of physical manuscripts. Foliation is approximate. Wright often does not indicate ending folia so those have been assumed based on beginning folia.
Scribal notes which could not be more clearly classified based on Wright's descriptions have been identified as <addition>s whether they occur in the margins or the body of the manuscript.
In general, we have classified as an <msItem> as much of the manuscript contents as possible, including tables of contents and indices.

category.catDesc: Catenae Patrum and Demonstrations against Heresies
Councils of the Church and Ecclesioastical Canons

langUsage.language: Unvocalized Syriac of any variety or period
Arabic Garshuni in Vocalized West Syriac Script
